the best ski destination in Japan\" class=\"pin-it-button\" count-layout=\"horizontal\"&gt;&lt;img border=\"0\" src=\"\/\/assets.pinterest.com\/images\/PinExt.png\" title=\"Pin It\" \/&gt;&lt;\/a&gt;&nbsp;\n\n          &lt;a href=\"https:\/\/twitter.com\/share\" class=\"twitter-share-button\" data-url=\"http:\/\/www.nightjartravel.com\/magazine\/niseko-best-ski-destination-japan\" data-text=\"Niseko, the best ski destination in Japan\" data-via=\"nightjartravel\" data-count=\"none\"&gt;Tweet&lt;\/a&gt;\n          &nbsp;\n\n          &lt;div class=\"email-button nightjar-email-button\" data-url=\"http:\/\/www.nightjartravel.com\/magazine\/niseko-best-ski-destination-japan\" data-title=\"Niseko, the best ski destination in Japan\"&gt;&lt;\/div&gt;\n        &lt;\/div&gt;\n\n        &lt;div class=\"mag-date\"&gt;Apr 2015&lt;\/div&gt;\n\n\n\n        &lt;p&gt;Words Rupert Orchard&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;Niseko\u2019s reputation as one of the best powder-skiing destinations in world and the only truly international ski resort in Japan were recognised last year when it was &lt;a href=\"http:\/\/htholidays.com\/blog\/view\/niseko-clean-sweep-in-the-world-ski-awards\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;awarded Japan\u2019s Best Ski Resort at the World Ski Awards&lt;\/a&gt;. The area is treated to 15 metres of the world\u2019s lightest, driest powder snow annually, attracting skiing and snowboarding devotees from around the world.&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img class=\"float-left\" src=\"\/sites\/default\/files\/2015-1\/Niseko%201.jpg\" border=\"0\" width=\"270\" height=\"180\" style=\"border: 0;\"&gt;It is also home to one of the most vibrant international dining and drinking scenes in Japan. Michelin star chefs and wine and whisky sommeliers call Niseko home, lured by the natural beauty of the region, the quality of local produce and a diverse international clientele.&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;In addition to world-class skiing and dining, the area is blessed with a bounty of mineral-rich hot spring water and an array of traditional &lt;a href=\"http:\/\/htholidays.com\/guest-services\/view\/onsen-information\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;Japanese &lt;em&gt;onsen&lt;\/em&gt; &lt;\/a&gt;(public baths), which have become as much a part of the apr\u00e8s ski culture as a glass of Gl\u00fchwein on the Austrian ski slopes.&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;Niseko\u2019s growth in international popularity over the last ten years has given rise to the development of many premium hotels, condos and holiday services. New accommodations are frequently appearing in the area, however there are a few options that are truly a cut above the rest for quality and value.&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;h2&gt;Top 5 accommodations in Niseko&lt;\/h2&gt;&lt;h3&gt;Sekka Kan&lt;\/h3&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=\"border-style: initial; border-color: initial; border-image-source: initial; border-image-slice: initial; border-image-width: initial; border-image-outset: initial; border-image-repeat: initial;\"&gt;&lt;span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"&gt;&lt;img class=\"float-right\" src=\"\/sites\/default\/files\/2015-1\/Niseko%202.jpg\" border=\"0\" width=\"270\" height=\"180\" style=\"border: 0;\"&gt;&lt;\/span&gt;&lt;\/span&gt;&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=\"http:\/\/sekkakanniseko.com\/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;Sekka Kan&lt;\/a&gt; was judged to be &lt;a href=\"http:\/\/htholidays.com\/blog\/view\/niseko-clean-sweep-in-the-world-ski-awards\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;Japan\u2019s best ski chalet at last year\u2019s World Ski Awards &lt;\/a&gt;and for good reason too. The beautifully designed boutique apartment block sits in the centre of Niseko\u2019s Hirafu village, a short walk to the Ace Family chairlift and just steps from some of Niseko\u2019s best restaurant and bars. Despite this, the location offers maximum privacy and comfort.&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;The apartments combine the best of Western luxury living and contemporary Japanese design with high ceilings, the latest appliances and Nespresso machines. The real winner for us, however, is the top-floor balcony jacuzzi. Ski the deep Japanese powder all day and follow it up with a relaxing soak in the outdoor tub, a couple of drinks and stunning views of the nearby volcano Mt. Yotei.&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;h3&gt;Ki Niseko&lt;\/h3&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=\"http:\/\/kiniseko.com\/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;Ki Niseko&lt;\/a&gt; is a stylish boutique ski-in ski-out resort hotel, with doorstep access to Niseko\u2019s world-class powder skiing. Only 50 metres from the Niseko Grand Hirafu high-speed gondola, it\u2019s the perfect location for the kind of skier who values convenience and time on the slopes.&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;h3&gt;&lt;img class=\"float-left\" src=\"\/sites\/default\/files\/2015-1\/Niseko%203.jpg\" border=\"0\" width=\"270\" height=\"179\"&gt;&lt;\/h3&gt;&lt;p&gt;Better still, the private ski valet means you can step through the door after a big day of riding and pass your equipment straight to the friendly staff for overnight tuning and care. Add premium Japanese dining, a &lt;a href=\"http:\/\/kiniseko.com\/en\/nisekos-best-onsen\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;private onsen&lt;\/a&gt; and stunning mountain views to the mix and it\u2019s not hard to see why this new hotel has people talking.&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;h3&gt;Yama Shizen&lt;\/h3&gt;&lt;p&gt;The beauty of a stay at &lt;a href=\"http:\/\/yamashizenniseko.com\/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;Yama Shizen &lt;\/a&gt;is that you get the whole Niseko experience. A mere four-minute walk to the Hirafu high-speed gondola, its upper-village location also offers easy access to a range of restaurants and bars that sit in the vicinity of the 39-apartment complex.&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;Guests can also make use of the on-snow ski valet service that\u2019s included when you stay, which enables you to drop off your gear right next to the gondola before taking a relaxed stroll back to the apartment. Yama Shizen rooms offer the best in quality, comfort and privacy, making it an excellent choice for a worry-free stay in one of the world\u2019s best powder destinations.&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;h3&gt;Nozomi Views&lt;\/h3&gt;&lt;p&gt;Brand new for the 2014\/15 ski season, &lt;a href=\"http:\/\/nozomiviewsniseko.com\/niseko\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;Nozomi Views&lt;\/a&gt; sets the bar for modern luxury alpine accommodation.&nbsp;&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img class=\"float-right\" src=\"\/sites\/default\/files\/2015-1\/Niseko%204.jpg\" border=\"0\" width=\"270\" height=\"180\" style=\"color: #575757; font-size: 12px; line-height: 20px; text-align: justify; border: 0;\"&gt;&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;Located on Niseko\u2019s main road (Hirafu Zaka), the apartment is as stylish as it is convenient, with the Ace Family Chairlift just a two-minute walk from the property. It\u2019s also perfectly located to take in one of the best views of Mt. Yotei, and sits adjacent to Niseko\u2019s premier ski rental and retail facility, &lt;a href=\"http:\/\/htholidays.com\/guest-services\/view\/ski-and-snowboard-rental-rhythm\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;Rhythm Snowsports&lt;\/a&gt;.&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;h3&gt;Youtei Tracks&lt;\/h3&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=\"http:\/\/youteitracksniseko.com\/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;Youtei Tracks&lt;\/a&gt; is an iconic Niseko building in a premium, upper-village location. Completed in 2006, the units feature large windows allowing for maximum natural light, furnishings that have been hand selected by Australian interior designer Lynn Malone, plus premium appliances and facilities.&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;The complex contains a ski room with a fully-equipped tuning bench, however guests may prefer to use the complimentary, on-snow ski valet service instead.&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;So if you are a bit of a powder hound or just want to try out a new sport in this stunning part of the world, skiing in Niseko, Japan, should absolutely be up there on your bucket list.&lt;\/strong&gt;&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;h2&gt;More information&lt;\/h2&gt;&lt;p&gt;For information on booking premium accommodation in Niseko, visit the &lt;a href=\"http:\/\/htholidays.com\/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;HT Holidays website&lt;\/a&gt; or contact the reservations team at &lt;a href=\"mailto:reservations@htholidays.com\"&gt;reservations@htholidays.com&lt;\/a&gt;&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;br&gt;Source: &lt;a class=\"zest-gallery\"&gt;\n          &lt;div class=\"stage\"&gt;&lt;img \/&gt;&lt;\/div&gt;\n          &lt;div class=\"imgs\"&gt;\n                          &lt;img src=\"http:\/\/www.nightjartravel.com\/sites\/default\/files\/styles\/article_gallery\/public\/images-article\/Lewis%20Pugh%20M.jpg?itok=QnrqMeYg\" alt=\"\" title=\"\" \/&gt;\n                      &lt;\/div&gt;\n        &lt;\/div&gt;\n            &lt;div class='paging'&gt;\n        &lt;div class=\"mag-shares\"&gt;\n          \n          &lt;div class=\"g-plusone\" data-href=\"http:\/\/www.nightjartravel.com\/magazine\/lewis-pugh-visits-russia-after-completing-record-swim-series\" data-size=\"medium\" data-annotation=\"none\"&gt;&lt;\/div&gt;&nbsp;\n          &lt;div class=\"fb-like\" data-href=\"http:\/\/www.nightjartravel.com\/magazine\/lewis-pugh-visits-russia-after-completing-record-swim-series\" data-send=\"false\" data-height=\"20\" data-show-faces=\"false\" data-layout=\"button_count\"&gt;&lt;\/div&gt;&nbsp;\n          &lt;a href=\"http:\/\/pinterest.com\/pin\/create\/button\/?url=http:\/\/www.nightjartravel.com\/magazine\/lewis-pugh-visits-russia-after-completing-record-swim-series&amp;media=http:\/\/www.nightjartravel.com\/sites\/default\/files\/images-article\/Lewis%20Pugh%20M.jpg&amp;description=Lewis Pugh Visits Russia after Completing Record Swim Series\" class=\"pin-it-button\" count-layout=\"horizontal\"&gt;&lt;img border=\"0\" src=\"\/\/assets.pinterest.com\/images\/PinExt.png\" title=\"Pin It\" \/&gt;&lt;\/a&gt;&nbsp;\n\n          &lt;a href=\"https:\/\/twitter.com\/share\" class=\"twitter-share-button\" data-url=\"http:\/\/www.nightjartravel.com\/magazine\/lewis-pugh-visits-russia-after-completing-record-swim-series\" data-text=\"Lewis Pugh Visits Russia after Completing Record Swim Series\" data-via=\"nightjartravel\" data-count=\"none\"&gt;Tweet&lt;\/a&gt;\n          &nbsp;\n\n          &lt;div class=\"email-button nightjar-email-button\" data-url=\"http:\/\/www.nightjartravel.com\/magazine\/lewis-pugh-visits-russia-after-completing-record-swim-series\" data-title=\"Lewis Pugh Visits Russia after Completing Record Swim Series\"&gt;&lt;\/div&gt;\n        &lt;\/div&gt;\n\n        &lt;div class=\"mag-date\"&gt;Apr 2015&lt;\/div&gt;\n\n\n\n        &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;British endurance swimmer appeals to Russia to 'lead the world' in protecting the Ross Sea.&lt;\/strong&gt;&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;Renowned British endurance swimmer and United Nation\u2019s Environment Programme (UNEP)\u2019s Patron of the Oceans, Lewis Pugh, completed the final swim of his five swim challenge last month to champion the need for the conservation of the Ross Sea \u2013 and will now bring his own brand of 'speedo diplomacy' directly to the Kremlin.&nbsp;&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;Having set records for the most southerly swim in human history earlier in the expedition, Pugh concluded his challenge by swimming 500m in water with a temperature of 0\u00b0C off the coast of Peter I Island in the Bellinghausen Sea \u2013 one of 13 seas which surround Antarctica.&nbsp;&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img src=\"\/sites\/default\/files\/2015-1\/Lewis%20Pugh%202_0.jpg\" border=\"0\" width=\"578\" height=\"325\"&gt;&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;With the island named after the first Tsar and the sea named after Russia's most famous polar explorer, it was a poignant way to end the expedition. Russia chair the Commission for the Conservation of Antarctic Marine Living Resources (CCAMLR) and therefore hold the key to granting Marine Protected Areas (MPAs) in the Antarctic Ocean.&nbsp;&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;Speaking on the need to appeal to Russia, Pugh said;&nbsp;&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;\"Russia has a distinguished history in Antarctica. There are five Antarctic seas named after Russians, and nine Russian scientific bases in operation there. If anyone understands the beauty and the fragility of Antarctica, they do.&nbsp;&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img src=\"\/sites\/default\/files\/2015-1\/Lewis%20Pugh%203_0.jpg\" border=\"0\" width=\"578\" height=\"325\"&gt;&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;\"The aim of the 5 swims campaign was to bring the beauty and fragility of Antarctica into the hearts and minds of people around the world. Over the next few months I will be shuttling between CCAMLR nations urging policy makers in those key nations to agree the MPA in the Ross Sea \u2013 and moreover to agree to a network of effective MPAs in Antarctica. My first port of call will be the Kremlin. Russia has a once-in-a-generation opportunity to lead the world in preserving the waters around Antarctica. It would be a bold move, and it would send a positive, and peaceful, ripple around the globe.\"&nbsp;&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;Pugh has reason to feel optimistic ahead of his visit to The Kremlin as his efforts have captured the imagination of a nation \u2013 with constant media coverage in Russia following his expedition.&nbsp;&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img src=\"\/sites\/default\/files\/2015-1\/Lewis%20Pugh%204_0.jpg\" border=\"0\" width=\"578\" height=\"325\"&gt;&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;In scenes reminiscent of the 'ping pong diplomacy' of the 1970s, Pugh will be greeted in Russia by Slava Fetisov, one of Russia's greatest sporting heroes and former sports minister.&nbsp;&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;Speaking on the appeal of Lewis Pugh to Russia, Fetisov commented;&nbsp;&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;\"Our nation and people have a long-standing love and appreciation of Antarctica and Lewis' extreme display of human endurance demonstrates that this is a love shared around the world. Now more than ever we must find common ground on the major issues facing the world and I look forward to welcoming Lewis to Moscow to discuss the future.\"&nbsp;&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img src=\"\/sites\/default\/files\/2015-1\/Lewis%20Pugh%205_0.jpg\" border=\"0\" width=\"578\" height=\"325\"&gt;&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;Speaking on completing his five swims challenge, Pugh added \"The last swim was tough, especially given the limited recovery time after the bruising encounter in the Bay of Whales. I am exhausted and sailing home, but this is just the beginning \u2013 we have to influence the decision makers and Russia is crucial.&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;\"There are those who will say that the world is entering a 'new Cold War'. They will argue that Russia is distracted by pressing conflicts closer to home. I say that there is no more pressing issue right now than the protection of our global resources. If we get this right, it could have wider, positive ramifications \u2013 beyond the oceans \u2013 for international relations.\"&nbsp;&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;Follow Lewis\u2019s progress via his website, &lt;a href=\"http:\/\/www.lewispugh.com\"&gt;www.lewispugh.com&lt;\/a&gt; Twitter @LewisPugh #5Swims and Facebook \u2013 Lewis Pugh.&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;For more information visit - &lt;a href=\"http:\/\/www.lewispugh.com\u00a0\"&gt;www.lewispugh.com\u00a0&lt;\/a&gt;&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img src=\"\/sites\/default\/files\/2015-1\/Lewis%20Pugh%2012%20map.jpg\" border=\"0\" width=\"578\" height=\"325\"&gt;&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;h2&gt;The Route&lt;\/h2&gt;&lt;p&gt;Swim 1 - &lt;strong&gt;Campbell Island&lt;\/strong&gt; | 13 Feb&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;A long distance swim along Perseverance Harbour, a fjord in Campbell Island. The island, situated at 52\u00ba South, is a UNESCO World Heritage site with a large colony of Southern Royal Albatrosses and three penguins species \u2013 Eastern Rockhoppers, Erect-Crested and Yellow-Eyed Penguins.&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img src=\"\/sites\/default\/files\/2015-1\/Lewis%20Pugh%205_0.jpg\" border=\"0\" width=\"578\" height=\"325\"&gt;&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;Swim 2 - &lt;strong&gt;Cape Adare&lt;\/strong&gt; | 19 Feb&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;The first long distance swim around Cape Adare at 71\u00ba South. If successful, this swim will break the world record for the most southerly long distance swim ever undertaken. Cape Adare is the site of the first wintering by explorers on the Antarctic Continent. It's also home to the largest colony of Ad\u00e9lie penguins in the world. More than 250,000 pairs breed there.&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img src=\"\/sites\/default\/files\/2015-1\/Lewis%20Pugh%207.jpg\" border=\"0\" width=\"578\" height=\"325\" style=\"border: 0;\"&gt;&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;Swim 3 - &lt;strong&gt;Cape Evans&lt;\/strong&gt; | 23 Feb (cancelled because of atrocious weather with gale force winds)&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;Cape Evans is situated at 77.6\u00ba South and is where Captain Robert Falcon Scott, the British explorer, built a hut before racing the Norwegian explorer Roald Amundsen to the South Pole in 1911. Tragically, Scott died on the journey back with 4 colleagues. Lewis will have the privilege of preparing to swim around Cape Evans, in this historic building, which is still much the same as it was left over 100 years ago.&nbsp;&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img src=\"\/sites\/default\/files\/2015-1\/Lewis%20Pugh%208.jpg\" border=\"0\" width=\"578\" height=\"325\"&gt;&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;Swim 4 - &lt;strong&gt;Bay of Whales&lt;\/strong&gt; | 28 Feb&nbsp;&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;This is the most southern swim possible (there is no open sea further south in the world) at the Bay of Whales at 78.5\u00ba South. This bay was named by explorer Sir Ernst Shackleton due to the large number of killer whales seen in the area.&nbsp;&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img src=\"\/sites\/default\/files\/2015-1\/Lewis%20Pugh%209.jpg\" border=\"0\" width=\"578\" height=\"325\"&gt;&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;Swim 5 - &lt;strong&gt;Peter I Island&lt;\/strong&gt; | 6 Mar&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;Lewis' final swim will be at Peter I Island, which is in the Bellingshausen Sea at 69\u00ba South. This volcanic island is surrounded by pack ice for most of the year and is home to three seal species (Crab-eater, Southern-elephant, and the formidable Leopard Seal), is a breeding ground for southern fulmars, and is visited by Ad\u00e9lie and Chinstrap penguins.&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img src=\"\/sites\/default\/files\/2015-1\/Lewis%20Pugh%2010.jpg\" border=\"0\" width=\"578\" height=\"325\"&gt;&lt;\/p&gt;      &lt;\/div&gt;\n      \n          &lt;\/div&gt;\n  \n  \n    \n    \n  &lt;div class='author'&gt;\n  \n      \n    \n              &lt;img class=\"list-img\" src=\"http:\/\/www.nightjartravel.com\/sites\/default\/files\/styles\/managing_authority\/public\/Nightjar%20Cover.jpg?itok=ztFK0obu\" \/&gt;\n            &lt;h2&gt;Nightjar Travel&lt;\/h2&gt;\n        &lt;div class='bio'&gt;&lt;\/div&gt;\n      \n    \n      &lt;\/div&gt;\n&lt;\/div&gt;\n\n","\n\n&lt;div id=\"node-9614\" class=\"publisher-1335 node node-article clearfix content\" about=\"\/magazine\/down-river-0\" typeof=\"sioc:Item foaf:Document\"&gt;\n        &lt;div class=\"title-shim\"&gt;Down by the River&lt;\/div&gt;\n    &lt;img class=\"section-txt\" src=\"http:\/\/www.nightjartravel.com\/\" alt=\"\" title=\"\" \/&gt;\n    \n  \n  \n    &lt;h1&gt;\n    Down by the River  &lt;\/h1&gt;\n  &lt;span property=\"dc:title\" content=\"Down by the River\" class=\"rdf-meta element-hidden\"&gt;&lt;\/span&gt;&lt;span property=\"sioc:num_replies\" content=\"0\" datatype=\"xsd:integer\" class=\"rdf-meta element-hidden\"&gt;&lt;\/span&gt;  \n          \n          &lt;a href='http:\/\/www.countrylife.co.za' target='_blank' style='background-color: #222222' class='article-strip'&gt;\n        &lt;img src=\"http:\/\/www.nightjartravel.com\/sites\/default\/files\/cl.gif\" \/&gt;\n      &lt;\/a&gt;\n    \n    &lt;div class=\"content clearfix\"&gt;\n              &lt;div class=\"zest-gallery\"&gt;\n          &lt;div class=\"stage\"&gt;&lt;img \/&gt;&lt;\/div&gt;\n          &lt;div class=\"imgs\"&gt;\n                          &lt;img src=\"http:\/\/www.nightjartravel.com\/sites\/default\/files\/styles\/article_gallery\/public\/images-article\/Port%20Alfred%20LM.jpg?itok=pEWAG7N_\" alt=\"\" title=\"\" \/&gt;\n                      &lt;\/div&gt;\n        &lt;\/div&gt;\n            &lt;div class='paging'&gt;\n        &lt;div class=\"mag-shares\"&gt;\n          \n          &lt;div class=\"g-plusone\" data-href=\"http:\/\/www.nightjartravel.com\/magazine\/down-river-0\" data-size=\"medium\" data-annotation=\"none\"&gt;&lt;\/div&gt;&nbsp;\n          &lt;div class=\"fb-like\" data-href=\"http:\/\/www.nightjartravel.com\/magazine\/down-river-0\" data-send=\"false\" data-height=\"20\" data-show-faces=\"false\" data-layout=\"button_count\"&gt;&lt;\/div&gt;&nbsp;\n          &lt;a href=\"http:\/\/pinterest.com\/pin\/create\/button\/?url=http:\/\/www.nightjartravel.com\/magazine\/down-river-0&amp;media=http:\/\/www.nightjartravel.com\/sites\/default\/files\/images-article\/Port%20Alfred%20LM.jpg&amp;description=Down by the River\" class=\"pin-it-button\" count-layout=\"horizontal\"&gt;&lt;img border=\"0\" src=\"\/\/assets.pinterest.com\/images\/PinExt.png\" title=\"Pin It\" \/&gt;&lt;\/a&gt;&nbsp;\n\n          &lt;a href=\"https:\/\/twitter.com\/share\" class=\"twitter-share-button\" data-url=\"http:\/\/www.nightjartravel.com\/magazine\/down-river-0\" data-text=\"Down by the River\" data-via=\"nightjartravel\" data-count=\"none\"&gt;Tweet&lt;\/a&gt;\n          &nbsp;\n\n          &lt;div class=\"email-button nightjar-email-button\" data-url=\"http:\/\/www.nightjartravel.com\/magazine\/down-river-0\" data-title=\"Down by the River\"&gt;&lt;\/div&gt;\n        &lt;\/div&gt;\n\n        &lt;div class=\"mag-date\"&gt;Apr 2015&lt;\/div&gt;\n\n\n\n        &lt;p&gt;Words and pics Marion Whitehead&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;This jolly bunch is always ready to party and the small Eastern Cape seaside town\u2019s 125th birthday last year was celebrated with a regatta, an anything-that-floats derby, a grub crawl and a grand parade along the riverbank, joined by a fleet of antique tractors from the Bathurst Agricultural Museum nearby.&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;The popular holiday destination was once an important river port, with tall-masted sailing ships mooring at the wharf. When dredging the Kowie River mouth became too expensive, smaller fishing vessels dominated the port \u2013 until local fishing quotas were awarded elsewhere. These days, boating for pleasure and sport on the 22 kilometres of navigable river is where the action is. Wharf Street has become a small waterfront attraction with its own microbrewery, restaurants, a tiny theatre, antiques and collectables shops and, of course, a fish and chip shop.&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;\u201cOur boat is tiny,\u201d Maryna Shepherd, a teacher at the local high school for the last 16 years, told me over a tasty alfresco lunch at Zest Caf\u00e9. \u201cIt\u2019s just got a 2HP engine, but we like to putter up the river to fish on weekends.\u201d&nbsp;&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;The Kowie River rises in the hills around Grahamstown and meanders to the coast, eventually meeting the sea between a man-made breakwater and a pier frequented by anglers. A sunset river-cruise boat chugged along at a sedate pace past numerous private jetties, to game farms where tangled riverine vegetation tumbles down steep cliffs. I was admiring a magnificent Fish Eagle swooping down for its catch when we were overtaken by a sleek rowing boat. Powered by a team of fit young oarsmen, it sliced through the water at speed, leaving us in its wake. I had to laugh out loud.&nbsp;&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img src=\"\/sites\/default\/files\/2015-1\/Port%20Alfred%202.jpg\" border=\"0\" width=\"578\" height=\"324\"&gt;&lt;em&gt;Mansfield Park manager Pierre Joubert and his staff, Francina Potgieter and rangers Edward de Kock and Gerhard Visagie, offer guided game drives.&lt;\/em&gt;&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;Truth is, there\u2019s room for whatever floats your boat on the Kowie River, posh or humble. There are millionaires\u2019 yachts parked in the small craft harbour next to the Royal Alfred Marina, but no one minds if you launch your canoe from there. In the bar at the Ski Boat Club across the river, postmen rub shoulders with magistrates in this fishermen\u2019s lair.&nbsp;&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;\u201cYou can also launch your boat from the public slipway just here behind the tourist info office,\u201d said tourism director Sandy Birch. \u201cIn December, it\u2019s also the end point of the Kowie River Mile swim. And at Christmas, just watch out for a naked Father Christmas skiing down the river in his Christmas hat.\u201d The annual prank is supposed to be hush-hush, but Sandy laughed and admitted that everyone knew about it.This is a town of great contrasts existing side by side, Sandy said. Shacks in Nemato settlement have the same splendid views as the grand old settler mansions high on the riverbanks. Stenden University\u2019s Dutch and German students, together with trainee pilots from 43 Air School just up the road, have brought a new vibrancy to a town once dominated by retirees.&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;Naturally, water sports are big and, apart from surfing at East Beach and swimming on the Blue Flag Kelly\u2019s Beach, at Outdoor Focus Adventure Centre you can organise anything from diving to hydrobiking and adrenaline sea cruises on which wet suits&nbsp;are standard issue.&nbsp;&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;One of the delights for families is Kiddies Beach, a sheltered lagoon next door to Outdoor Focus. It\u2019s the kind of place where you can put up your umbrella for a lazy picnic and let little ones paddle, build sandcastles and swim safely while you relax with a good book.&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;At the heart of the Eastern Cape\u2019s Sunshine Coast, Port Alfred claims to have one of the Cape\u2019s highest numbers of sunshine days beaming down on its spectacular beaches. However, when the weather doesn\u2019t play ball, Sandy sends visitors off to explore the plethora of junk shops and restaurants \u2013 many staffed by students and graduates of Stenden, the Dutch hospitality university that has its South African campus in Port Alfred.&nbsp;&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img src=\"\/sites\/default\/files\/2015-1\/Port%20Alfred%203.jpg\" border=\"0\"&gt;&lt;em&gt;It\u2019s paradise on water at the upmarket Royal Alfred Marina, where the homes have private jetties.&lt;\/em&gt;&nbsp;&nbsp;&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;Delroy Chipumuro, ma\u00eetre d\u2019 at the Wharf Street Brew Pub, is a Stenden graduate from Zimbabwe. \u201cOnce you\u2019re in Port Alfred, you don\u2019t want to leave. It\u2019s so relaxed here,\u201d he said with a grin, placing tasters of local beer in front of me: Kowie Gold Pilsener, Coin Ale and Squires Porter.&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;The stone warehouse in which the pub is found is one of the oldest commercial buildings in town. \u201cIt used to be the customs house and later became the offices of the mayor and council offices. It was even the local movie house for a time,\u201d said chef-owner Bram Coetzee, pulling a pint made in the Little Brewery on the River next door where his dad is the consultant brew master.&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;The Kowie History Museum nearby has taken on a new life since it moved into the old railway station, and features pictures of the town before the bridges were built. \u201cThe two halves of town used to be linked only by&nbsp;a pont at the site of what is today Putt Bridge,\u201d said curator Yvonne Surtees. A historic riverside walking trail starts at the museum, where you purchase a pamphlet to guide you along Wharf and Van der Riet streets.&nbsp;&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;Bad weather never seems to deter enthusiasts at the Royal Port Alfred Golf Course, which has an unusual team of \u2018lawnmowers\u2019 \u2013 a small herd of impala that takes little notice of birdies and eagles. It\u2019s one of just four golf courses in South Africa to have the title \u2018royal\u2019 bestowed on it after British royalty enjoyed games there in the 1920s.&nbsp;&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;Kowie, as Port Alfred is fondly referred to by locals, is a place that exerts the same kind of pull that the tides have on fishermen. Pierre Joubert worked across the world \u2013 Botswana, Namibia and the US \u2013 after completing his internship as a field guide at Port Alfred\u2019s Mansfield Private Game Reserve. But when the job of manager at the small private reserve on the Kowie River was advertised, he didn\u2019t hesitate to apply. \u201cI didn\u2019t think twice. I like the little town and, because it\u2019s a small reserve, we do everything and have personal contact with the guests,\u201d he explained.&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;Marianne and Rob Field, owners of Panorama B&amp;B on a hill high above the river, landed up here because of a small advert in COUNTRY LIFE. \u201cIt showed a jetty at sunset,\u201d said Rob, explaining that the couple were running a guest lodge in Namibia at the time and wanted to scale down. They visited and were hooked.&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;\u201cWe looked at lots of little coastal towns, but Port Alfred has everything you need,\u201d added Marianne. \u201cThere are even game reserves around here, so we don\u2019t miss out on that either. There\u2019s lots to do, so I\u2019m never bored.\u201d Down by the riverside, life just couldn\u2019t get better.&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;br&gt;Source:&nbsp;&lt;a href=\"http:\/\/www.countrylife.co.za\/subscribe\/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;Country Life&lt;\/a&gt;&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;a class=\"link-interest\" href=\"http:\/\/www.nightjartravel.com\/node\/1472\"&gt;&lt;br&gt;Port Alfred Diving&lt;br&gt;&lt;\/a&gt;&lt;a class=\"link-interest\" href=\"http:\/\/www.nightjartravel.com\/node\/3727\"&gt;Duneboarding - Port Alfred&lt;br&gt;&lt;\/a&gt;&lt;a class=\"link-interest\" href=\"http:\/\/www.nightjartravel.com\/node\/3658\"&gt;Hydrobiking, Port Alfred&lt;\/a&gt;&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&nbsp;&lt;\/p&gt;      &lt;\/div&gt;\n      \n          &lt;\/div&gt;\n  \n  \n    \n      &lt;div class='bio'&gt;&lt;\/div&gt;\n      \n    \n      &lt;\/div&gt;\n&lt;\/div&gt;\n\n","\n\n&lt;div id=\"node-9565\" class=\"publisher-3008 node node-article clearfix content\"    &lt;img class=\"section-txt\" src=\"http:\/\/www.nightjartravel.com\/\" alt=\"\" title=\"\" \/&gt;\n    \n  \n  \n    &lt;h1&gt;\n    Ocean Surf Ski Paddler Safety Precautions  &lt;\/h1&gt;\n  &lt;span property=\"dc:title\" content=\"Ocean Surf Ski Paddler Safety Precautions\" class=\"rdf-meta element-hidden\"&gt;&lt;\/span&gt;&lt;span property=\"sioc:num_replies\" content=\"0\" datatype=\"xsd:integer\" class=\"rdf-meta element-hidden\"&gt;&lt;\/span&gt;  \n          \n          &lt;a href='http:\/\/mockepaddling.com\/surfski-school' target='_blank' style='background-color: #000000' class='article-strip'&gt;\n        &lt;img src=\"http:\/\/www.nightjartravel.com\/sites\/default\/files\/mockelogo_0.gif\" \/&gt;\n      &lt;\/a&gt;\n    \n    &lt;div class=\"content clearfix\"&gt;\n              &lt;div class=\"zest-gallery\"&gt;\n          &lt;div class=\"stage\"&gt;&lt;img \/&gt;&lt;\/div&gt;\n          &lt;div class=\"imgs\"&gt;\n                          &lt;img src=\"http:\/\/www.nightjartravel.com\/sites\/default\/files\/styles\/article_gallery\/public\/images-article\/Surf%20Ski%20Safety%201%20%28M%29.jpg?itok=IdBtk0dp\" alt=\"\" title=\"\" \/&gt;\n                      &lt;\/div&gt;\n        &lt;\/div&gt;\n            &lt;div class='paging'&gt;\n        &lt;div class=\"mag-shares\"&gt;\n          \n          &lt;div class=\"g-plusone\" class=\"fb-like\" data-href=\"http:\/\/www.nightjartravel.com\/magazine\/ocean-surf-ski-paddler-safety-precautions\" data-send=\"false\" data-height=\"20\" data-show-faces=\"false\" data-layout=\"button_count\"&gt;&lt;\/div&gt;&nbsp;\n          &lt;a href=\"http:\/\/pinterest.com\/pin\/create\/button\/?url=http:\/\/www.nightjartravel.com\/magazine\/ocean-surf-ski-paddler-safety-precautions&amp;media=http:\/\/www.nightjartravel.com\/sites\/default\/files\/images-article\/Surf%20Ski%20Safety%201%20%28M%29.jpg&amp;description=Ocean Surf Ski Paddler Safety Precautions\" class=\"pin-it-button\" count-layout=\"horizontal\"&gt;&lt;img border=\"0\" src=\"\/\/assets.pinterest.com\/images\/PinExt.png\" title=\"Pin It\" \/&gt;&lt;\/a&gt;&nbsp;\n\n          &lt;a href=\"https:\/\/twitter.com\/share\" class=\"twitter-share-button\" data-url=\"http:\/\/www.nightjartravel.com\/magazine\/ocean-surf-ski-paddler-safety-precautions\" data-text=\"Ocean Surf Ski Paddler Safety Precautions\" data-via=\"nightjartravel\" data-count=\"none\"&gt;Tweet&lt;\/a&gt;\n          &nbsp;\n\n          &lt;div class=\"email-button nightjar-email-button\" data-url=\"http:\/\/www.nightjartravel.com\/magazine\/ocean-surf-ski-paddler-safety-precautions\" data-title=\"Ocean Surf Ski Paddler Safety Precautions\"&gt;&lt;\/div&gt;\n        &lt;\/div&gt;\n\n        &lt;div class=\"mag-date\"&gt;Apr 2015&lt;\/div&gt;\n\n\n\n        &lt;p&gt;Words Dawid Mocke and NSRI,&nbsp;pics courtesy Charl van Wyk, race director of the &lt;a href=\"http:\/\/www.facebook.com\/PeteMarlinsurfski\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;PETE MARLIN SURFSKI RACE&lt;\/a&gt;&nbsp;&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;Following the tragic death of Mark Feather off East London in November 2014, Sea Rescue has been asked for recommended safety precautions and tips on what to do if search and rescue is needed.&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;There is seldom one simple answer so we have put together suggestions that we believe should be taken into account when a paddle is to be undertaken.&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;Weather and sea conditions can change fast and paddlers should factor in that they need to stay afloat and warm for whatever the rescue period is going to be. Even with emergency beacons and flares, a rescue could take a few hours, depending on place, conditions and accuracy of information.&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;It is important for paddlers to know that there are three phases to a rescue operation:&lt;\/strong&gt;&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;1.initiation,&lt;br&gt;2.general search&lt;br&gt;3.and specific location of the paddler.&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img src=\"\/sites\/default\/files\/2015-1\/Surf%20Ski%20Safety%202.jpg\" border=\"0\" width=\"578\" height=\"325\"&gt;&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;h2&gt;Basic safety:&lt;\/h2&gt;&lt;p&gt;It is very difficult to spot someone in the water \u2013 so please make sure that we can see you. Often we only get one glimpse of a bright colour \u2013 especially in strong wind conditions.&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;\u2022&nbsp;Paddle in a buddy system.&lt;br&gt;\u2022&nbsp;Wear a brightly coloured PFD.&nbsp;&lt;a href=\"http:\/\/mockepaddling.com\/product\/mocke-racer-pfd-2014\/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;See here: MOCKE PFD&lt;\/a&gt;.&lt;br&gt;\u2022&nbsp;Wear a brightly coloured rash vest (lumo green or orange is best).&lt;br&gt;\u2022&nbsp;Have a cell phone in a waterproof bag (test that you can use this in all conditions).&nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&nbsp; &nbsp;&lt;a href=\"http:\/\/mockepaddling.com\/product\/cellphone-dry-bag\/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;See here: CELLPHONE Dry Bag&lt;\/a&gt;.&lt;br&gt;\u2022&nbsp;Use a leash from the ski\u2019s foot straps to your body. &lt;a href=\"http:\/\/mockepaddling.com\/product\/mocke-life-line-calf-leash\/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;See here: Calf Leash&lt;\/a&gt;.&lt;br&gt;\u2022&nbsp;Know who to call for help and be sure that your family know who to call. Be sure that someone knows where you are and when you should return. And that they will call for help if this time is exceeded.&lt;br&gt;\u2022&nbsp;Have a signal flare (hand held are best) or pencil flares.&lt;br&gt;\u2022&nbsp;Carry a reflector\/mirror.&lt;br&gt;\u2022&nbsp;Have a whistle that works when wet.&lt;br&gt;\u2022&nbsp;Have your name and landline number on your surf ski.&lt;br&gt;\u2022 Leave a card with your name and phone number (cell and landline) on your vehicle dashboard.&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img src=\"\/sites\/default\/files\/2015-1\/Surf%20Ski%20Safety%203.jpg\" border=\"0\" width=\"578\" height=\"325\"&gt;&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;h2&gt;Good ideas and practices:&lt;\/h2&gt;&lt;p&gt;\u2022&nbsp;Have a brightly coloured surfski or put bright reflective tape on your boat and on the paddle blades.&lt;br&gt;\u2022&nbsp;Check if the boat will float if broken. Internal floatation is often an issue.&lt;br&gt;\u2022&nbsp;Take appropriate thermal protection for the conditions that you are paddling in.&lt;br&gt;\u2022&nbsp;Keep an emergency bank bag in the back of your vest with an allan key, bung, cable ties and space blanket.&lt;br&gt;\u2022&nbsp;Make sure that you know what to do in an emergency, have practised it, and know that you can do it when hypothermic.&lt;br&gt;\u2022&nbsp;If you use a bright hat make sure that it is tied to your PFD. &lt;a href=\"http:\/\/mockepaddling.com\/product\/mocke-fly-dry-visor\/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;See here: Fly-Dry Visor&lt;\/a&gt;.&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;h2&gt;Who to call for help:&lt;\/h2&gt;&lt;p&gt;\u2022&nbsp;Call for help sooner rather than later.&lt;br&gt;\u2022&nbsp;Hypothermia will affect your ability to think faster than you realise.&lt;br&gt;\u2022&nbsp;Have the local NSRI number programmed in your phone&lt;br&gt;&nbsp; (find the number on &lt;a href=\"http:\/\/www.nsri.org.za\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;www.nsri.org.za&lt;\/a&gt;).&lt;br&gt;\u2022&nbsp;Call your friend or family member who is waiting for your return and ask them to call NSRI.&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;h2&gt;Flares:&lt;\/h2&gt;&lt;p&gt;The hand held flares are brighter and easier to see than pencil flares. They are also easier to use when hypothermic. If you have one flare it is best to keep it until you can see a rescue boat. If two flares, fire one at once and keep the other for when you can see a rescue boat, and if six flares, always keep the last one for when a rescue boat is close.&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img src=\"\/sites\/default\/files\/2015-1\/Surf%20Ski%20Safety%204.jpg\" border=\"0\" width=\"578\" height=\"325\"&gt;&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;h2&gt;There are three tracking systems, or combinations of systems to consider:&lt;\/h2&gt;&lt;h4&gt;Use a cell phone app such as MySOS&lt;\/h4&gt;&lt;p&gt;This will only work where there is cell coverage, the phone must be a smart phone that you can use in a bag, it must float and must have enough battery life. This can be tracked by family, friends or event organisers.&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;h4&gt;Use an AIS MOB device&lt;\/h4&gt;&lt;p&gt;This is waterproof, has long battery life and lasts for 24 hours after activation. It is expensive but simple to activate and can be seen by all vessels with AIS enabled GPS chart plotters (including NSRI vessels). It gives an exact position. If out of range \u2013 or out of direct line of sight, the signal will not be picked up. The transmitting range is about 4NM depending on conditions.&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;h4&gt;Use a 406MHz PLB device&lt;\/h4&gt;&lt;p&gt;Also expensive, waterproof and the signal is picked up by satellite which sends a message to the local Maritime Rescue Coordinating Centre. This can take some time to activate rescue as the satellite must \u2018see it.\u2019 Then the message is sent to the MRCC which will only react if the beacon has been properly registered with the correct details. Because of the time delay it is not ideal for paddlers.&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img src=\"\/sites\/default\/files\/2015-1\/Surf%20Ski%20Safety%205.jpg\" border=\"0\" width=\"578\" height=\"325\"&gt;&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;h2&gt;Frequently asked Questions:&lt;\/h2&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;1.Stay or swim?&nbsp;&lt;\/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;It is generally better to stay with your craft as it makes you easier to find and float. Sometimes you may decide to swim \u2013 but if you do this you must know that it will be very hard to spot a head in the water \u2026 and that the distance that you swim will probably be double what you thought you would have to swim.&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;2. In or out of the water?&lt;br&gt;&lt;\/strong&gt;Whichever keeps you warmest.&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;3. When do you call for help?&lt;br&gt;&lt;\/strong&gt;Call at the first sign of trouble. NSRI would prefer to respond to someone who thinks that they are in trouble than someone in a bad situation.&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;4. What info does NSRI need:&lt;br&gt;&lt;\/strong&gt;Who you are and where you are. What the trouble is, how many people need help and how much battery life you have in your cell phone. A GPS position and local current and wind would be a great help.&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;5. Use the buddy system?&lt;br&gt;&lt;\/strong&gt;Stay together, help each other and check who has what rescue equipment that can be used.&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;The &lt;a href=\"http:\/\/www.facebook.com\/PeteMarlinsurfski\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;PETE MARLIN SURFSKI RACE&lt;\/a&gt;, part of the World Surfski Series will take place in East London on 14 November 2015.&nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;\/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;Source: &lt;a href=\"http:\/\/mockepaddling.com\/ocean-surf-ski-paddler-safety-precautions\/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;Mocke Paddling&lt;\/a&gt;&lt;\/p&gt;      &lt;\/div&gt;\n      \n          &lt;\/div&gt;\n  \n  \n    \n    \n  &lt;div class='author'&gt;\n  \n      \n    \n      &lt;a href=\"http:\/\/mockepaddling.com\/surfski-school\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;        &lt;img class=\"list-img\" src=\"http:\/\/www.nightjartravel.com\/sites\/default\/files\/styles\/managing_authority\/public\/mocke_logo_cover_0.png?itok=AkX4C-BX\" \/&gt;\n      &lt;\/a&gt;      &lt;h2&gt;Mocke Paddling&lt;\/h2&gt;\n        &lt;div class='bio'&gt;&lt;\/div&gt;\n      \n    \n      &lt;\/div&gt;\n&lt;\/div&gt;\n\n","\n\n&lt;div id=\"node-9652\" class=\"publisher-4123 node node-article node-promoted clearfix content\" about=\"\/magazine\/cameron-bellamy-and-his-magnificent-indian-ocean-crossing\" typeof=\"sioc:Item foaf:Document\"&gt;\n        &lt;div class=\"title-shim\"&gt;Cameron Bellamy and his magnificent Indian Ocean crossing&lt;\/div&gt;\n    &lt;img class=\"section-txt\" src=\"http:\/\/www.nightjartravel.com\/\" alt=\"\" title=\"\" \/&gt;\n    \n  \n  \n    &lt;h1&gt;\n    Cameron Bellamy and his magnificent Indian Ocean crossing  &lt;\/h1&gt;\n  &lt;span property=\"dc:title\" content=\"Cameron Bellamy and his magnificent Indian Ocean crossing\" class=\"rdf-meta href='' target='_blank' style='background-color: #09906f' class='article-strip'&gt;\n        &lt;img src=\"http:\/\/www.nightjartravel.com\/sites\/default\/files\/A%202015%20logo%20s.jpg\" \/&gt;\n      &lt;\/a&gt;\n    \n    &lt;div class=\"content clearfix\"&gt;\n              &lt;div class=\"zest-gallery\"&gt;\n          &lt;div class=\"stage\"&gt;&lt;img \/&gt;&lt;\/div&gt;\n          &lt;div class=\"imgs\"&gt;\n                          &lt;img src=\"http:\/\/www.nightjartravel.com\/sites\/default\/files\/styles\/article_gallery\/public\/images-article\/M%20Cameron%20Bellamy_0.jpg?itok=4yATc6sH\" alt=\"\" title=\"\" \/&gt;\n                      &lt;\/div&gt;\n        &lt;\/div&gt;\n            &lt;div class='paging'&gt;\n        &lt;div class=\"mag-shares\"&gt;\n          \n          &lt;div class=\"g-plusone\" data-href=\"http:\/\/www.nightjartravel.com\/magazine\/cameron-bellamy-and-his-magnificent-indian-ocean-crossing\" data-size=\"medium\" data-annotation=\"none\"&gt;&lt;\/div&gt;&nbsp;\n          &lt;div class=\"fb-like\" data-href=\"http:\/\/www.nightjartravel.com\/magazine\/cameron-bellamy-and-his-magnificent-indian-ocean-crossing\" data-send=\"false\" data-height=\"20\"
